description: Sakurai Tomoki has been having the same strange dream since he was a child and would wake up in tears. Sugata, an upperclassman at his school, believes the dream to be of the new continent. Later that night, while waiting under the cherry trees for Sugata and his childhood friend, an angel called Ikaros comes flying down and his peaceful life changes from then on.

tags.name: Angels
tags.description: Prominently features spiritual beings usually represented with wings and halos and believed to be attendants of God.

tags.name: Female Harem

tags.description: Prominently features a character who generally retains a cold, blunt and cynical exterior, but once one gets to know them, they have a very warm and loving interior.

tags.name: Nudity

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Surreal Comedy
tags.description: Prominently features comedic moments that defy casual reasoning, resulting in illogical events.

tags.name: Large Breasts
tags.description: Features a character with larger-than-average breasts.

tags.name: Artificial Intelligence
tags.description: Intelligent non-organic machines that work and react similarly to humans.

tags.name: Robots

tags.name: Chibi
tags.description: Features "super deformed" character designs with smaller, rounder proportions and a cute look.

tags.name: Memory Manipulation
tags.description: Prominently features a character(s) who has had their memories altered.

tags.name: Outdoor Activities
tags.description: Centers around hiking, camping or other outdoor activities.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

tags.name: Yakuza

tags.name: Shrine Maiden

tags.name: Feet
tags.description: Features the sexual depiction or stimulation of a character's feet.

node.description:
__Birth Name:__ Sakiko Fujita (藤田咲子)

[Blog](https://blog.goo.ne.jp/sakky-ohana) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/sakitaf_1019)

She is best known in Japan for sampling her voice for the Vocaloid, Hatsune Miku.

**Birthplace:** Los Angeles, California
**Spouse:** Rachel Robinson (2019-)

**Introduction:**
Christopher Bevins, alternatively known as Chris Bevins is an American voice actor, ADR director and script/screenwriter. He is more known for his work as an ADR director at FUNimation Productions in Dallas/Fort Worth, Texas.

**Non-anime roles:**
~!- Dhalsim and Soldier A (David) in "Street Fighter V" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter IV" (VG)
- Dhalsim in "Street Fighter X Tekken" (VG)
- Koga, Brycen and Swimmer in "Pokémon Masters" (VG)
- Legault in "Fire Emblem Heroes" (VG)
- Nadai in "Fist of the North Star: Lost Paradise" (VG)
- Shishiwakamaru in "Yu Yu Hakusho: Dark Tournament" (VG)
- Voice in "FUNimation" (logo bumper)
!~
**Non-anime staff credits:**
~!- Script Adaptation for "Sengoku Basara: Samurai Heroes" (VG)!~

__Height:__ 173 cm

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ta2hisa_suzuki) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/ta2hisa_suzuki/)

Tatsuhisa is a Japanese voice actor and singer, and he is affiliated with I'm Enterprise and Lantis. He is the vocalist of the rock band [OLDCODEX](https://anilist.co/staff/112151/OLDCODEX) under his stage name Ta_2, who also provides the opening/ending themes of many of the anime he stars in. He not only sings but also composes some of the songs. He also belongs to Style Five, in charge of the endings of Free! He also likes bicycling, karaoke, reading and video games. 

He is known for his numerous roles in anime series, his main breakout roles in the West were as Takao in Kuroko no Basuke and especially as Makoto Tachibana in Free!. He is not only known for his voice in anime, but also in video games. For example, he gave voice to Noctis (FFXV) and Alfonse (FEH). 

He is married to the famous singer [LiSA](https://anilist.co/staff/105561/LiSA). In late July 2021, it was reported that he was involved in an affair with a 20-year old fan. The next month he announced that he would suspend all entertainment activities due to poor health, later issuing an apology for his "irresponsible and inappropriate actions". His agency stated that he would gradually resume activities while recovering. In March 2022, his agency announced his full return to work from hiatus, along with another apology to fans.

**Height:** 151.6 cm

[Official Website](https://www.takagakiayahi.com/) | [Music Ray'n profile](https://musicrayn.com/takagaki_ayahi) | [Official Blog](https://ameblo.jp/takagakiayahi-blog/)

Ayahi Takagaki graduated from a Tokyo music college majoring in operatic singing. Her professionally trained operatic voice can be heard in songs like "Life", "Inori" or "Justice".

One of the members of Seiyuu Group, [Sphere](https://anilist.co/staff/103636).

**Non-anime roles:**
- Aloy - Genshin Impact

__Agency:__ I'm Enterprise

[Profile](https://www.imenterprise.jp/profile.php?id=74) | [Website](https://hayamisaoriofficial.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/hayami_official)  | [YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCtUcK6HrhD024CkPDsURBwg) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/hayamisaori_official/)

Member of the duet [Blue Drops](https://anilist.co/staff/106305/Blue-Drops) with [Hitomi Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/101088/Hitomi-Yoshida).

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/xexex36) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/yoshihiro_watanabe1971/) | [Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/渡邊義弘_(アニメーター%29)

An animator, character designer and adult game artist.

_Not to be confused with the producer [of the same name.](https://anilist.co/staff/233840)_
[Blog](http://ameblo.jp/ranranan-mina/)

__Height:__ 150 cm

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/nomizuiori) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nomizuiorichan/) | [Youtube](https://www.youtube.com/@nomizuiorichan/videos) | [Blog](https://ameblo.jp/nomizuiori1018/)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/ogura_koubou)

In 1977, Ogura joined *Kobayashi Production* and learned the ropes of art direction under [Shichirou Kobayashi](https://anilist.co/staff/103964/Shichirou-Kobayashi). In 1983 he left and established Studio Fuga together with Kouji Oono and [Toshiharu Mizutani](https://anilist.co/staff/121908/Toshiharu-Mizutani). There he eventually left as well and formed his own 'Ogura Kobo' at Production I.G., where he trains newer art directors. He continues to be a major presence at Production I.G. as one of their most prominent art directors.

Ogura's style is, similar to Kobayashi's, rooted in imposing architecture, ambient colors, and Western perspectives versus traditional Japanese isometric perspectives. Ogura's backgrounds are usually urban in setting and has a less saturated color palette, and uses more cool than warm colors. Ogura's fantastical, European Kobayashi influence is easily seen in [Wings of Honneamise](https://anilist.co/anime/1034/Ouritsu-Uchuugun-Honneamise-no-Tsubasa/), and his later work has remained distinctly metropolitan, something that can be seen even in the rural [FLCL](https://anilist.co/anime/227/FLCL/).
Group consisting of singers [Hitomi Yoshida](https://anilist.co/staff/101088/Hitomi-Yoshida) and [Saori Hayami](https://anilist.co/staff/95869/Saori-Hayami).
